articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: John's Cats
articles.contents:
Yuki


This is Yuki. My partner had her, a rescue of a rescue, for about a year before I came home, and she was already very senior. She was a very cranky and particular girl, but, still, she accepted me and welcomed me home immediately. We miss Yuki terribly.


Jinx


This is Jinx! She and her brother and sister were baby kittens under the deck of our house when we moved in, and they have all been the best cats ever!


Bruiser


Bruiser is a big sweet silly goof.


Ladybird


And this is Ladybird, who, if you ask her, is an only child, at least out in public. She’s the most precious and delicate little sweetheart, as long as she’s not hunting lizards!


Everyone


Here are more pictures of those same cats! You’re welcome!

articles.title: John Wise's Public Repository
articles.contents:
John Wise's Public Repository
          
          
          Analysis
          Writing
          
          
          About
           
          ▾
          
          
          Introduction to John Wise
          Resume
          CV
          Cats
          Contact
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              John Wise’s Public Repository
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Welcome to my repository/website!
            My name is John Wise, and I spent nearly 19 years
            incarcerated in Florida. During my time inside, I dedicated
            myself to studying mathematics and data science with the
            aspiration of someday communicating my experience of being
            incarcerated.
            This repository serves as a platform where I can share my
            endeavors, including my insights on incarceration and some
            of my creative writing. My main goals for creating this
            website are twofold:
            To express my strong opposition to the practice of
            incarcerating people as punishment for crime, which I
            believe is absurd, wasteful, and perpetuates harm.
            To showcase my work, with the hope of being discovered
            by potential employers or supporters who can provide me with
            access to additional data and financial resources to
            continue my important work.
            Through this website, my goal is to raise awareness about
            the challenges faced by those who have been incarcerated,
            advocate for substantial and meaningful change in the
            criminal legal system, and work towards the closure of
            prisons.
            Thank you for visiting my repository and joining me on
            this journey.
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              John Wise’s Public Repository
            
            
              
                
                                  
              
            
            
              
              Welcome to my
              repository/website!
              My name is John Wise, and I spent nearly 19 years
              incarcerated in Florida. During my time inside, I
              dedicated myself to studying mathematics and data science
              with the aspiration of someday communicating my experience
              of being incarcerated.
              This repository serves as a platform where I can share
              my endeavors, including my insights on incarceration and
              some of my creative writing. My main goals for creating
              this website are twofold:
              To express my strong opposition to the practice of
              incarcerating people as punishment for crime, which I
              believe is absurd, wasteful, and perpetuates harm.
              To showcase my work, with the hope of being discovered
              by potential employers or supporters who can provide me
              with access to additional data and financial resources to
              continue my important work.
              Through this website, my goal is to raise awareness
              about the challenges faced by those who have been
              incarcerated, advocate for substantial and meaningful
              change in the criminal legal system, and work towards the
              closure of prisons.
              Thank you for visiting my repository and joining me on
              this journey.

      1.0.4a"

      not free." -- Eugene V. Debs,
